Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady...it is indeed the right man. I thought it was very good...and promptly lost it. I hope you are trundling along. I have just had Herceptin no 6 and I'm hobbling along.
Posts.Title: After Breast cancer treatment.Very helpful article by ? Psychologist...

Posts.Content: I have read a good article by a Psychologist (I think ) about our problems having completed treatments. It was very helpful but sadly I can't find it ! Does anyone know what I mean ? I would be very happy to find it again . Sorry about sketchy details !
Posts.Title: After Breast cancer treatment.Very helpful article by ? Psychologist...

Posts.Content: Not a good few days really. Sorry for the moan. oe neg, her + lobular tumour , one lymph node involved. Mastecomy a year ag , 12 Taxol and am now on Herceptin (10) backed by Ramipril. I always seem to get diarrhoea and feel pumped up all over strangely about two weeks after infusion. Also painful back hip and just about everywhere else. Today I have almost convinced myself that I have spread everywhere !  Please someone cheer me up.......might take determination but I know only you can do it ! I would post a picture of Eeyore if I knew how to. But I don't.
Posts.Title: Feeling rather Eeyore !

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady. You always come to my Aid . For some time I've been feeling quite jolly but today I have felt a bit less positive. I need to pull myself together. Thank you for the Eeyore too. How are you getting on. How far have you got with Herceptin ? I never hear you moan !
Posts.Title: Feeling rather Eeyore !

Posts.Content: Helen.... Thank you for a lovely Eeyore....I could be looking in the mirror !
Posts.Title: Feeling rather Eeyore !

Posts.Content: Perhaps they think that when our treatment finished we got the  ‘All Clear’!   Lovely thought but a bit wide of the mark. I remember a Cancer Research or Macmillan piece among the adverts where a woman rushed into the room to tell her family her cancer was ‘all clear’ Much celebration followed. I think it was pulled soon after !
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: I have Grade 2 Her2+ lobular cancer. I have had a mastectomy,12 weekly doses of Taxol followed by 15 infusions of Herceptin. Before I started Herceptin I was ‘borderline’ and I trundled on till it was stopped at 15 because the vef had gone down. I had a final echo three months after Herceptin stopped and I have just had the result.......the percentage was 35 %....apparently better than the previous one ! I am already taking Ramipril. I really need to hear from anyone who has stopped Herceptin and whose heart has mended. I would also like to know how to make this print bigger ! Thank you so much.
Posts.Title: Herceptin and heart damag

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone.....I need some support please ! .Am I the only one who is making heavy weather of getting through 12 weeks of Taxol ?  The first 6 weeks were fairly ok then I got an infection and was in hospital for five days. I started again two weeks ago plus my first Herceptin infusion which went without a hitch. So I only have four more sessions of Taxol to go. I'm not feeling great ...very tired,headache (?sinuses) and generally not very well. I should admit to being 74 and so older than most of you here. I have to accept that I won't 'bounce back' so easily but am beginning to wonder if it's all worth it. I can only hope I can continue to have Herceptin. I have been given Ramipril to help .I am feeling rather defeated today. My husband is manfully holding the fort.....! My cancer was Her+ Grade 2 with one lymph node involved.
Posts.Title: Taxol 12 weeks......having trouble.

Posts.Content: Let us know how you get on. My BP is fine..sometimes low which makes me a bit dizzy. Drinking loads of water cures this. I need to drink more(water) but it's hard. Incidentally I now can't drink red wine as it tastes like vinegar. I blame the Herceptin!
Posts.Title: Taxol 12 weeks......having trouble.

Posts.Content: Annie....the day after Chemo is usually the 'best'. I guess that is down to the steroids. Then the next two days are the worst. Then things slowly get better until they cut you off at the knees again ! You might sail through.....several ladies here do. Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Taxol 12 weeks......having trouble.

Posts.Content: Thank you Gay for the encouragement to soldier on. You're right I'm nearly there.
Posts.Title: Taxol 12 weeks......having trouble.

Posts.Content: Hello Rumcat. Sorry you are having thes scary problems but once you know your Oncologist's plan you will feel a bit better. I too have autoimmune problems . I think we could do without any extras don't you !  I also am oestrogen negative and Herceptin positive. I have had a (second) mastectomy, Chemo and Herceptin. I finish Herceptin in April. I am 75 and have managed it and so can you. It's not what we'd choose but life has got a habit of surprising us. The treatment hasn't affected the autoimmune problems much in fact I think the Chemo was quite helpful strangely. If you are on any immusuppresants you will probably have to stop taking them during treatment but they will explain all of that to you. I remember what it was like when I was diagnosed so I do feel for you. I sometimes think being so geriatric ( 75) I should stop moaning and just get on with it but inside I am still about 30! Do stay here. You will get wonderful first hand advice. Let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Is Cellcept Mycophenolate? I stopped taking that and didn't have any problems...probably because I had steroids with the Chemo. Perhaps the Chemo just takes our minds off other problems for a time !
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Hello Rumcat. Sorry you are having thes scary problems but once you know your Oncologist's plan you will feel a bit better. I too have autoimmune problems . I think we could do without any extras don't you !  I also am oestrogen negative and Herceptin positive. I have had a (second) mastectomy, Chemo and Herceptin. I finish Herceptin in April. I am 75 and have managed it and so can you. It's not what we'd choose but life has got a habit of surprising us. The treatment hasn't affected the autoimmune problems much in fact I think the Chemo was quite helpful strangely. If you are on any immusuppresants you will probably have to stop taking them during treatment but they will explain all of that to you. I remember what it was like when I was diagnosed so I do feel for you. I sometimes think being so geriatric ( 75) I should stop moaning and just get on with it but inside I am still about 30! Do stay here. You will get wonderful first hand advice. Let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Is Cellcept Mycophenolate? I stopped taking that and didn't have any problems...probably because I had steroids with the Chemo. Perhaps the Chemo just takes our minds off other problems for a time !
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Thank you London Lass. I think that's it. We're probably all independent ladies who have had their lives taken over and controlled by others. It can't be any other way but it's not what we're used to !
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Yes we have exchanged posts before. I normally just lurk ! I will crack on with the Herceptin as long as my Oncologist lets me. I was given Ramipril to help my heart while having Herceptin. I hope it's working. Before that no one had any concerns for my heart or BP!
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Thank you Susan. Yes they certainly know what they are doing. They are a super team here. The problem is, I suppose, is that I feel I have lost control of my life !
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Dreamthief....Thank you for the encouraging reply. I am hoping the Ramipril is working and steadying my LVEF. Time will tell. Silly me was expecting to skip off to the future in my best party frock. I now know that's no how it works !
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Thank you Moomy. We are too old for all of this aren't we ? I suppose we can't expect to live forever ! Last time round I was 'only' 58. It seems like two minutes ago !
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: What happened..........well in my brain I'm 30 and I can't understand when I look in the mirror I see an ancient crone with no boobs and no hair. Can it be me ? Will try to stop being so eeyore !
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Hello everyone. Please excuse a whinge from a seventy-ish year old patient . I went for a final mammogram in December because I thought it was the right thing to do. Oh dear ! This led to biopsies ,ultrasound, CAT scan .MRI and a mastectomy . Results showed the tumour to be lobular grade 2 Her2 positive. Oh dear again . To cut a long story short I had 12 infusions of Taxol and I have had 3 Herceptins. My echocardiogram showed 50%. I have been taking Ramipril and have a second echocardiogram before I continue. What is worrying me is what happens if I can't have any more Herceptin. Has anyone else been taken off the Wonderdrug ? Also two weeks after finishing Taxol I am still feeling pretty exhausted and pathetic and down in the dumps. Ihad a second MRI two weeks ago and am not getting those results till the end on June. They wanted a second MRI because the MDM couldn't agree whether a tiny spot was a met or not. How does everyone else cope ? (I am aware that nearly all of you are much younger than I am. So I apologise for that......Old people get scared too ! )
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Heavens above Seaspirit. What a lot you've been through ! I do admire your optimistic spirit and will try to be more like you. I had Breast  cancer eighteen years ago but it was an easier type . I also have an autoimmune disease. Yes I have a husband who has been very good  and supportive. Unfortunately both children work and live abroad although our daughter is coming on Saturday for a week. No other relatives anywhere near but good friends.
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !

Posts.Content: Thank you Lucy.
Posts.Title: Everything in my life topsy turvy !
